loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio originario de Granada, de 35 años de edad, casado, padre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 6, 8, y 12 años actualmente están estudiando, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa y alquiler de sillas. El inicio trabajando por su propia cuenta, alquilando sillas,  con ayuda de su esposa quien lo motivo a tener  su propio negocio ya que necesitaban el dinero extra para el sostén de su familia, este ha sido su único negocio, el cuenta con otros ingresos como es el trabajo extra que realiza como profesor de educación física, sus expectativas es diversificar su negocio comprando mas Productos que aun no tiene en existencia y poder comprar los encargos que le hacen sus clientes.
El  esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar ropa como blusas, faldas, vestidos, etc. Ya que el estima que este préstamo le seria de mucha ayuda porque  así podrá comprar toda la mercadería  que necesita para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, sus planes futuros es ampliar su negocio para tener mejores oportunidad de ventas, su metas próximas es comprar mas ropa  variada para incrementar sus ventas y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Julio is from Granada.  He’s 35 years old, married, and has three children, ages 6, 8, and 12; they all go to school.  He is a merchant and sells clothing and rents out chairs.  He started working on his own, renting out chairs, with his wife’s help, who motivated him to start his own business because they needed extra money to provide for the family.  This has been his only business but he has another income from his salary as a physical education teacher.  He wants to diversify his business with more products that he doesn’t have now and to be able to buy the things that his customers request.

He is asking for this loan to buy clothing such as blouses, skirts, dresses, etc.  He estimates that this loan will be of great help because it will allow him to buy all the merchandise that he needs to satisfy his customer demand.  He plans to grow his business in the future so that he can have better sales opportunities.  His next goal is to buy clothing to increase his sales and earn greater profits.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer and high-efficiency printer.

loans.name: Asadullah

texts.en:
Mr Aziz has been Nazava’s reseller in Bogor [60km south of Jakarta, the capital] since 2011. He has sold over a hundred water filters and also established a network of resellers in several cities in Indonesia. 

Mr Aziz: “I heard about Nazava from a friend. After learning more about Nazava on the web, I contacted the manager Syahri Abdillah and applied to become a reseller for Nazava Water Filters. To become a resellers I had to invest 200 USD in stock. After 6 months of saving money I had enough money to register as a reseller of Nazava Water Filters. I asked a friend to make a website and ever since I promote Nazava Water Filters to friends, colleges and people that I meet." 

"The prospect of this business is very good. Slowly but surely the mindset of people regarding how to obtain drinking water is changing. Instead of boiling water, which is expensive and a hassle, people more and more accept the technology of Nazava. My ambition is to sell more water filters and increase my profit so that my family can live more comfortable. I also wish that people will know me as a green technology activist and water filter salesmen.”

With help of KIVA credit Mr. Aziz can have a larger stock with a larger variety of filters. Subsequently he will place advertisements in local newspapers and will also try to advertise Nazava through the local radio stations. By the end of this year he plans to rent a new shop in Bogor which is very expensive. So Mr. Azis really needs the loan in order to be able to pay for bigger stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of water filters and this will increase the access to safe and affordable drinking water in his region

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en: Chanthol is a resident of the Bovel district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. She is 33 years old and married with two dependent daughters, both of whom are school-aged children. Chanthol earns a living through farming rice on a six-hectare plot of farm, earning around 22,000 KHR per day and saving approximately 17,000 KHR for future needs after canceling out the daily expenses. Chanthol, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a loan group of four female members to seek for a loan of 200,000 KHR each. To avoid using unsanitary practices, the group leader Chanthol plans on using her loan portion to build a latrine for use by her family. Via the help of this loan, Chanthol can create a healthier environment for the family, especially for her school-aged children.

loans.use: To build a latrine

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer humilde del páramo ecuatoriano, ella tiene 51 años y todavía sigue airosa y con mucha fuerza para el trabajo, María se define como una persona muy reservada, alegre en los momentos que pasa con su familia, María ama mucho a su familia y le encanta el campo, es por ello que desde pequeña se dedicó a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales.
El crédito solicitado a FODEMI se lo invertirá en la compra de dos vaconas para la crianza y cuando ya estén las harán reproducir y se dedicaran a la distribución de leche, María comenta que el trabajo del campo es sacrificado pero tiene muchos réditos ya que se pasa en familia y cuando se pone muchas ganas las ganancias económicas son muy buenas.
El sueño que doña María tiene es el tener una pequeña finca con muchas cabezas de ganado para ser distribuidora de leche y vender en los mercados y en las comunidades aledañas donde ella vive.
texts.en:
Maria is a humble woman from the Ecuatorian hills.  She is 51 years old and is still airy and strong enough to work.  Maria is known for being reserved and happy when she is with her family.  She loves her family very much and she loves the country.  This is why she farms and raises animals.

She will use the money from this loan from FODEMI to invest in two cows to raise, reproduce, and sell their milk.  Maria says that working in the country requires lots of sacrifice, but she has much revenue that that she passes to the family and when things are good, the financial gains are very good.

Maria’s dream is to have a small farm with many heads of livestock so she can be a milk distributor and sell to markets in the surrounding communities.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Yanett Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Yanett tiene 28 años de edad, originaria de Granada, madre de 1 hijo de 3 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio  con un pequeño préstamo que le hizo una institución financiera, fue allí que decidió establecer su propio negocio comprando ropa usada y calzado, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su compañero  que le ayuda a atender a los clientes, también vende verduras  que es otra forma de conseguir ingresos y diversificar su negocio, se siente satisfecha con su negocio porque es mas rentable, cuenta con clientes fijos. 
En esta ocasion esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar toda la mercadería en general como ropa, zapatos arroz, melón, tomate, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, todos los insumos necesarios para surtir su pulpería, ella estima el crédito será de ayuda ya que podrá invertir en su negocio lo que permitirá la atracción de más clientes generando a la vez mejores ingresos,  sus planes futuros es ampliar su pulpería, su meta próxima es llegar hacer una gran empresaria poniendo solo una tienda de ropa  para poder salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Yanett is 28 years old and from Granada.  She is the mother of a three year old son and has a grocery store.  She started her business with the help of a small loan from a financial institution and decided then and there to begin buying second hand clothing and shoes.  He has her husband’s encouragement and he helps her tend to customers.  She also sells vegetables as another way to generate an income and diversify her business.  She is satisfied with her business because it’s very profitable and she has steady customers.

On this occasion she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as clothing, shoes, rice, melons, tomatoes, sugar, beans, cooking oil, soap, and all the necessary supplies to stock her store.  She estimates that this loan will be helpful and she will be able to invest in her business, attract more customers, and increase her income.  Her plans for the future are to expand her store and her next goal is to become a great entrepreneur with her own clothing store so that she and her son can get ahead.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Meylin Del Carmen

texts.es:
Meylin, 27 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 1 hijo, de oficio comerciante se dedica al comercio como es la venta de gaseosa, con conocimientos académicos de tercer año de secundaria. Ella inicio su negocio con capital propio dinero que obtuvo de su anterior trabajo que era ayudarles a su hermana y a otras personas en el taller de  costura, luego al casarse decidió emprender su propio negocio como es la venta de cosméticos y gaseosa, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y su hermana, sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ventas y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Meylin solicita el préstamo para comprar  gaseosa y cosméticos como perfumes, ya que se acerca la época navideña en donde la demanda de sus productos crecen cada día más. Ella estima que este préstamo le será de gran ayuda ya que podrá invertirlo en su negocio comprando productos que aun no tiene en existencia, sus planes futuros es seguir diversificando sus productos para tener mejores ingresos, su meta próxima es tener un negocio estable y rentable .
texts.en:
Meylin is 27 years old, from Granada, is married and has a son.  She competed three years of middle school and sells soft drinks, having started out with money she had from a previous job helping her sister and others in a sewing workshop.  After she married, she decided to start her own business selling cosmetics and soft drinks.  She has her husband and sister’s support and expects to expand her business to increase her sales and be able to offer better service to her customers.

Meylin is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks and cosmetics like perfumes.  Now that the Christmas season is approaching, demand for her products goes up daily.  She estimates that this loan will be of great help because she will be able to buy products that she doesn’t have.  Her plans are to continue diversifying her products to have a better income.  Her next goal is to have a stable and profitable business.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La señora Nilda es originaria de la ciudad de Veracruz tiene ya mas de 10 años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
La señora Nilda esta solicitando un préstamo para los acabados del exterior de su vivienda ya que le esta haciendo falta pintar el frente ya que actualmente esta en malas condiciones.
La señor Nilda es empleado de una fabrica en el aria de producción desde hace ya mas de un año, una parte del sueldo que recibe es para pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad que actualmente estén estudiando la primaria.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia y que este en las mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Nilda is from Veracruz and has been living in Nuevo Laredo for 10 years.

She is asking for a loan to finish the exterior of her house; the front needs painting and is currently in bad shape.

Nilda has been working in a nearby factory for more than a year and she will use part of her salary to repay this loan.  The salary is her family’s source of income.  She’s the single mother of two children who attend elementary school.

She wants to improve her parenting and wants her family to have the best living conditions.

loans.use: to paint her house.

loans.name: Haniceta

texts.en: Haniceta is a 50-year old resident of Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City. Haniceta supports her family's needs with a monthly income of 2,000 PHP, the little amount she gains monthly from her gardening business that she has had for two years. However, this year she became a member of GDMPC and she has applied for a micro finance loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Haniceta wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna is age 52 and living in a rural area of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has nine children. She has been selling rice soup, and her husband supplements the family’s income through working for others for a fee. They have been in this business for 10 years. She is able to earn about KHR 7,000 per day.

Vanna has been with VisionFund for three cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Vanna completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a decent latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a healthy latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a decent latrine.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Age 30 years old, Channy is a married mother of two children, living in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. Catching fish is the main source of the family’s income. Channy has been in this business for 12 years and she is able to earn about KHR 7,000 per day and can manage to save about KHR 2,000 each day after daily expenses.

Channy has been with VisionFund for five cycles and successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her to improve the family's living conditions. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a proper latrine. Channy hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family’s use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a proper latrine.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 37 years old, single with 1 child, and is living in Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City. To make a living, Vilma grows bananas to sell, which she has been doing for 3 years. She earns 2,500 PHP a month. Vilma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Vilma joined GDMPC this year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines in larger quantities.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is a 54-year-old man from Agcabadi. He has been involved in buying and selling cattle and small livestock for more than 10 years. He is a very hardworking and conscientious man. Murad loves his business and goes to the market every week to buy livestock, which he fattens up, and then resells at the market. He requested a loan in amount of 1000 AZN, to buy livestock in order to expand his business. He appreciates your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Sokheang's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Kandal province’s Sa Ang district of Cambodia, Sokheng is 52 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer, while her husband works for others for a fee to earn additional family income. They have been in these businesses for thirty-four years and can earn about 50,000KHR per day from the current businesses.

This is the first micro-loan for Sokheng with VisionFund. Now he is leading his group of six to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes to have a clean latrine for his family to use.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Sokim's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province of Cambodia, Sokim is a 32-year-old. She is married and has two children; one is in school while the remaining one is still too young for school. She has been into vegetable growing for several years. The current business earns her about 10,000 KHR daily and she manages to save about 4,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Sokim has been with VisionFund for one cycle and successfully paid back the loan, which has helped her to relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a proper latrine for use by her family. She hopes to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a proper latrine for use by her family.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en: Alfreda is a 39-year-old living in Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City. She has provided for the needs of her 4 children with the small amount of 2,200 she has been earning monthly from her vegetable production business for the last 2 years. Her business is an aid to the income her husband earns from farming. Recently, Alfreda joined GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Kishimkan

texts.ru: Кишимкан 59 лет,вдова, мать 7 детей.После распада СССР Кишимкан получила часть своей земли. Кишимкан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи с 1991 года начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. После смерти мужа весь бизнес остался на ней, благодоря сыну и дочери Кишимкан она справляется со всеми обязанастями.  Начатый с суммы 1,000 KGS бизнес в 1992 году, благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Кишимкан , на сегодня насчитывает 6 коров, 20 голов овец, 25 коз и 3 кобылы и приносит доход около 10,000 - 12,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кишимкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. На средства полученные от реализации скота будущей осенью, она планирует построить большой сарай.
texts.en: Kishimkan is 59 years old, she is a widow and a mother of seven children. After the collapse of the USSR Kishimkan has received a part of her land. She has been doing animal husbandry and field crop cultivation since 1991 as a main source of income for her family. After her husband's death the entire business has been left to herself and thanks to her son and daughter Kishimkan has been keeping all in order. The business which was started with an amount of 1,000 KGS in 1992 right now has six cows, twenty heads of sheep, 25 goats and three horses which brings around 10,000-12,000 som a month thanks to her hard work and perseverance. With the goal to further grow her business Kishimkan has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to buy cattle. She plans to use the received profit from selling the cattle in the fall to build a large shed.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Jelieta

texts.en: Jelieta is a 46-year-old living in Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City. She has provided for the needs of her 5 children with the small sum of 2,200 she has been earning monthly from her gardening production business for the last 2 years. Her business is an aid to the income her husband earns from farming. Recently, Jelieta joined GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Perviz

texts.en: Parviz is a 29-year-old man. He is married, and has two sons. He has a very small business; keeping sheep for meat purposes. But he would like to extend his business by purchasing calves for meat production. He applied for credit of 1000 AZN to realize this idea. He will spend this money to purchase 3 calves and mixed fodder.

loans.use: to purchase 3 calves.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en: Ermelinda's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting root crops for sale. She is a widowed 59-year-old. She is from Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City and has been farming for 3 years, earning an amount of 2,000 per month. This year, Ermelinda joined GDMPC. Ermelinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en:
Arvin is 30 years old, single and works very hard for his parents.

Arvin has a selling used clothing business in the Philippines. Arvin requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of used clothes to sell.

Arvin has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Arvin would like to save money to expand his business and to secure their family's' future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Rahib

texts.en: Rahib is a 31-year-old man who has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 12 years. He is married and has two sons. He usually sells his crops in the central bazaar and to the local vendors. His monthly profit is 200 AZN and he would like to increase it. His eldest son helps him to raise the crops and sell them in the bazaar. Rahib applied for a loan of 1000 AZN loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and new land.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and new land.

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 25-year-old, hardworking and independent woman. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and daughter, who is a student. Her husband has a small stationery shop and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. For the last 3 months Ghazala has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase more cosmetic products like makeup kits, facial creams, hair styling products etc. for her beauty salon.
For that reason, Ghazala as a member of seven-person lending group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. First of all she will repay the loan amount to Kiva and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too congested. She hopes that her business grows more and she is very much thankful to both Brac and Kiva. Note: In the picture, Ghazala is carrying a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products like makeup kits, facial creams, hair styling products etc. for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen, 50 years old, is married and has 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Belen has run a general store in the Philippines for 4 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear items. She has requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy stock such as sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Belen has previously borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock such as sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 46 лет, имеет одну дочь. Замира имеет среднее образование, по характеру она очень трудолюбивая, целеустремленная и доброжелательная женщина. Шесть лет назад, в поисках  дохода для своей семьи, Замира начала свой бизнес в пошиве национальной одежды. Дополнительным источником для семьи является животноводство.  Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, начатый с 10,000 сом (KGS) шесть лет назад бизнес на сегодняшний день приносит около 4,000 сом в месяц от продажи молока и молочных изделий. Доходы от бизнес-деятельности позволяют Замире оплачивать учебу в школе для своей дочери. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Zamira is 46 years old and has a daughter. Zamira has secondary education. She is a very hard-working, purposeful and friendly woman. Six years ago, while looking for a source of income for her family, Zamira launched her business of sewing traditional Kyrgyz clothing. The family also supplements its income by raising livestock - thanks to Zamira's hard work, this business, started six years ago with 10,000 som (KGS), presently brings them around 4,000 som per month from sales of milk and dairy products. Her business income allows Zamira to pay for her daughter's schooling.

In order to continue developing her business, Zamira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Saymuhamad

texts.ru: Саймухамад проживает в районе Муминобод. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него четверо сыновей. Жена Саймухамада домохозяйка, двое его сыновей студенты, а двое других учатся в школе. Саймухамад занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пятнадцать лет. Он берет кредит с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Saymuhamad lives in the Muminobod of Tajikistan. He is 45 years old, married, and has four sons. Saymuhamad's wife takes care of the household, two of his sons are university students, while two others attend school. Saymuhamad has been buying and reselling cattle for the past fifteen years. He is taking this loan in order to increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: to purchase cows and calves

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru:
Баргигул проживает в городе Куляб. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Баргигул предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Она занимается шитьем. Этим видом деятельности Баргигул занимается почти тридцать лет. 
Баргигул берет кредит для покупки тканей. Она хочет сшить платья разных видов для продажи.
texts.en:
Bargigul lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 50 years old and married with five children.  Bargigul provides sewing services from her home.  She has been in this business for almost 30 years.

Bargigul is taking out this loan to buy fabric.  She wants to sew various types of dresses to sell.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing dresses to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 40 years old and married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She is applying for her second loan of $1,000 , which she will use to buy additional supplies to keep in her store such as soft drinks, hard drinks, body loosen(Citra), and biscuits. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, hard drinks, body loosen (Citra) and biscuits.

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en: Kanchi is 55 years old. She is married and has 2 children ages 35 and 28. In 2000, she established her goat raising business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW.  She requested to use the most recent loan to buy baby goats for her business. In the future, Kanchi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy baby goats.

loans.name: Chris

texts.en: Even with the qualifications as a doctor, Chris could not find a good job. He therefore struggled until he started a small clinic and drug shop with his little resources. The need in his village created the opportunity, since the residents did not have access to medical care with the nearest health center so many kilometers away.  With a few shillings he started a clinic in rural Lyantonde to serve the needs of the residents.  He now wants a loan to buy more drugs so that he can adequately meet the needs of his clients. He is a hardworking man that wants to change the lives of the community in which it operates.

loans.use: to buy drugs for his clinic.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en: Shova is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 21 and 16. In 2000, she established her cow milk selling business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW. She has requested her most recent loan to buy a young milk giving cow. In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Note:  Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk giving cow.

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en: Jovito is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran. He is 43 years old. Jovito is married and has 2 children. To make a living, he manages a business buying and selling fish and crabs. He has been in the fish vending business for 3 years and earns PHP 10,000 a month from these activities. In 2011, Jovito joined GDMPC. Jovito is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 which will be used to buy additional fish to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Vohidjon

texts.ru:
Вохидчон 45 - летний женатый мужчина проживающий в районе Шахритус. Он является отцом двоих детей. Жена Вохидчона работает преподавательницей. 
Вохидчон занимается своим бизнесом. Он построил коровник, создал необходимые условия для разведения крупнорогатого скота у себя дома. Вохидчон занимается купле - продажей коров и быков. В этой области он два года. Вохидчон берет кредит для закупа коровы и телят.
texts.en: Vohidjon is a 45-year-old man who resides in the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan. He is a father of two children. Vohidjon's wife works as a teacher, while he runs his own business. Vohidjon has built a cow shed and created all the necessary conditions for raising cattle at home, and now buys and resells cows and bulls. He has been in this line of work for two years. Vohidjon is taking this loan to purchase a cow and calves.

loans.use: to buy a cow and some calves

loans.name: Mobil

texts.en: Mobil is from Agjabadi, Azerbaijan. He is 40 years old, married, and has one school-aged son. To make a living, Mobil owns and operates a business buying and selling fruits. He has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 300 per month from it. Mobil requested a new loan of 1000 AZN which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mobil from AqroInvest and Kiva. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new camera for movie making business.

loans.name: Behruz

texts.en: Behruz is a 27-year-old farmer who sells seasonal fruits and vegetables together with his wife. He sells the fruits and vegetables in the street of his home city, Agjabadi, and has been doing this for the last five years. He applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He wishes to open his own shop next to his house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy is 30 years old, married and has three children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Cristy owns and manages a general store to earn a living. She has had this business for 7 years. Each month she earns Php 10,000 from her store. Cristy requested a loan of Php 34,000 to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Cristy has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand and she will be able to sustain her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Сухроб житель города Худжанд. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена юрист, она работает по профессии. Сухроб занимается торговлей. Он арендует помещение, где открыл магазин оргтехники. Сухроб открыл магазин оргтехники "Гигабайт". В этой области он восемь лет. 
Сухроб берет кредит для приобретения новых моделей ноутбуков и многофункциональных принтеров, а также для покупки запасных частей компьютеров.
texts.en:
Suhrob is a resident of the city of Khujand.  He is 28 years old and married with two children.  His wife is an attorney.  Suhrob is in sales.  He opened a office machines business in a rented store.  His store is called "Gigabyte."  He has been in this field for eight years.  

Suhrob is taking out this loan to buy new models of notebook computers, multifunction printers, and spare parts for computers.

loans.use: to buy new models of notebook computers, multifunction printers, and spare parts

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: Phally is 25 years old, and lives in a rural area of the Bovel district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. She is blessed with four children, all of whom are under her responsibility. One of Phally‘s children is too young for schooling while the rest are school-aged children. To make the living, Phally farms rice on a two-hectare plot of farm. Having been involved in the rice-growing business for ten years, Phally is able to earn approximately 16,000KHR daily. Phally, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a loan group of five members to take out a loan in the amount of 200,000KHR each. In hope to avoid using unsanitary practices, Phally will utilize her loan portion to build a proper latrine for use by the family. With the help of the requested loan portion, Phally will be able to create a healthy environment as well as promote sanitation and hygiene practices in her community.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Чамшед занимается торговлей женской и детской обуви. Он арендует магазин на рынке города. Торговлей Чамшед занимается 5 лет. Он берет кредит для покупки зимней женской обуви.
texts.en:
Jamshed lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 42 years old and married with three children.  Jamshed is in the business of selling women's and children's shoes.  He rents his shop, which is in the city's market.  He has been in the sales business for five years.

He is taking out this loan to buy women's winter shoes.

loans.use: to buy women's winter shoes

loans.name: Rama

texts.en: Rama is 46 years old. She is married and has 2 children ages 28 and 25. In 1998, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW.  She has requested to use her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Rama plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Note:  Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia, a 35-year-old, hardworking woman, lives in Pakistan with her husband and 6 children.  Her husband operates a welding shop. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Asia is trying to help him fulfill their needs by providing embroidery services in her community. She has excellent embroidery skills. She wants to generate more income by purchasing some embroidery materials like, threads, needles etc.
For this Asia is a member of a 7-member lending group that has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase necessary things for her business to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future.

loans.use: to purchasing some embroidery materials like, threads, needles etc.

loans.name: Rutty

texts.en: When times were tough for Rutty after failing to find a job because of his low level of education, he settled for agriculture, but does not regret the choice he made. He has since become one of the major suppliers of plantain, a major delicacy in the nearby trading center.  He also sells to people that transport the plantain to other towns. He now wants a loan to buy mulch and organic manure to put in his plantain plantation. With the manure, his yields will be higher and his plantains will be bigger in size, therefore increasing his sale price and profits. He is a very hardworking and committed man. In the photo Rutty is in his banana (plantain) plantation.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and mulches.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам проживает в городе Худжанд. Он 50 - летний женатый мужчина. У него двое детей. Жена Рустама портниха. Его сыновья находятся за границей. 
Рустам арендует торговую точку на рынке. Он уже десять лет как занимается торговлей свежих лепешек. Кроме того он продает фрукты. Так как Рустам только начал торговлю фруктами ему необходима финансовая поддержка, чтобы увеличить оборот. 
Рустам берет кредит для покупки яблок, мандаринов, апельсинов, груши, гранта и винограда с целью расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 50 years old and is married with two children.  His wife is a seamstress and his sons live abroad.  Rustam rents a trading stall at the market.  He has been selling fresh bread for ten years and he also sells fruit.  Since he only started selling fruit recently, he needs financial support to increase his selection.  Rustam is asking for a loan to buy apples, mandarins, oranges, pears, pomegranates and grapes so he can expand his business.

loans.use: to buy apples, mandarins, oranges, pears, pomegranates and grapes to expand his business

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Fidèle est une jeune camerounaise de 24 ans, célibataire et mère d'une fille de 5 ans qui va à l'école. Elle possède et gère un kiosque dans un coin de la ville depuis 6 an où elle vend des crédits de communications, biscuits, friandises, . Dynamique et accueillant, elle considère que son stock de crédits est déjà insuffisant pour sa clientèle grandissante. le crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter le crédit de communication en gros auprès de fournisseurs (grossistes d'Orange et de MTN). Les bénéfices escomptés vont lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et avoir un mini kiosque d'une part et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'acheter un terrain d'autre part.
texts.en: Fidèle is a young woman from Cameroon, who is 24 years old, single and mother to a five-year old girl who goes to school. She has owned and managed a kiosque in a corner of the town for the past six years, and here she sells communication credit, biscuits and candy. She is dynamic and welcoming, but now she considers that her stock of credit is not sufficient for her expanding customer base. The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy communication credit wholesale from suppliers (Orange and MTN wholesalers). The profits she makes will enable her to increase her capital and maintain a mini-kiosque, as well as to provide for her family's needs and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy communication credit.

loans.name: Sufikhon

texts.ru:
Суфихон проживает в районе Зафаробод города Истаравшан. Ему 47 лет. Он женат. Жена Суфихона домохозяйка. У них один ребенок. Суфихон занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается двенадцать лет.
Суфихон берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Sufikhon lives in the city of Istaravshan in the Zafarobod region.  He is 47 years old and married.  His wife is a homemaker and they have one child.  Sufikhon buys and sells large livestock for a living.  He raises livestock on his own farm and he has been in this line of work for twelve years.  Sufikhon is asking for a loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз 45 лет, замужем, воспитала 1 ребенка. Кундуз работает оказывает услуги чабана односельчанам и в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 25 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 1,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кундуз в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная корова с приплодом, 5 голов мелкого рогатого скота,  ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кундуз обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коз и овец Доходы от кредита Кундуз планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством постройки скота.
texts.en: Kunduz is 45 years old and she is married with one child at home.  She provides a service to the shepherds in the village - as a source of income for her family, she has been involved in agriculture and raising livestock for 25 years.  She started this business with 1,000 KGS and thanks to her hard work, Kunduz now has one dairy cow with a calf and five sheep and goats and her monthly income from her farm is 4,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of increasing her business, Kunduz turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and goats.  She plans to reinvest the remainder of the loan into the development of her business by building up her head of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Kishimkan

texts.ru: Кишимкан 30 лет,замужем, мать 3 детей.После распада СССР Кишимкан получила часть своей земли. Кишимкан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи с 2000 года начала заниматься животноводством. Начатый с суммы 1,000 KGS бизнес в 2000 году, благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Кишимкан , на сегодня насчитывает 6 коров, 6 голов овеци 1 кобыла и приносит доход около 5,000 KGS в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кишимкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. На средства полученные от реализации скота будущей осенью, она планирует построить большой сарай и увеличить количество скотины.
texts.en:
Kishimkan is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  As a result of the collapse of the USSR, Kishimkan received her own plot of land.  Her family's main source of income is the livestock business she began in 2000.  Thanks to her hard work and persistence, the business she began in 2000 with a starting capital of 1,000 KGS today has six cows, six head of sheep, and one mare, and brings in an income of about 5,000 KGS per month.

With an aim to further developing her business, Kishimkan applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cattle.  With the money she earns from selling her cattle this coming autumn, she plans to build a large barn and to increase the amount of livestock she has.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ranjana

texts.en:
Ranjana is 35 years old. She is married and has two children aged nine and five. In 2006, she established her poultry farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy chickens for her business.  In the future, Ranjana plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens.

loans.name: Afshan's Group

texts.en:
Afshan is a 28-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and three sons in Punjab, Pakistan. Her husband is painter, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. 

Afshan herself has been running a small general store near her house. She needs additional capital to purchase some goods like biscuits, chips, candies, etc for her business. For that, Afshan, as a member of 7-person lending group, has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This will also help her to increase her savings for the better future of her children.

Afshan and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

Note: In the picture Afshan holds a pass book.

loans.use: to purchase some goods like biscuits, chips, candies, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 43 years old. She is married and has three children aged 22, 21 and 19.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Rita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has four children.  She produces palm kernel oil and red oil  for sale at  Dabir  near  Elmina, which she has done for some  years now.  Ama  uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  She will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and kernels to produce palm kernel oil to sell.  With the new profit,  Ama will buy a machine to produce her palm kernel oil.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and kernels to produce palm kernel oil to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 45 years old, is married and has five children. She lives in San Juan, Pana-on. Divina earns a living through selling vegetables. She has been operating this business for two years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from this work. 

Divina has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. Divina hopes to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle, 42, is a widow entrepreneur of Salimpono, Panaon. She has 2 children and is earning from her transport service business. It has operated for almost 2 years now and she earns about 6,000 PHP a month. To improve business, she is borrowing the amount of 16,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which Anabelle just joined in 2011, to obtain accessories and tires. Anabelle is hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 28-year-old married woman. Her husband is a carpenter. Her elder son is in the press club, while the rest of her 3 children are students. Bushra has been running a beauty parlor for the past five years. She has gotten a lot of appreciation through her work. She is very talented and knows the art of makeup very well. She makes enough to support her family well.

Due to an increase in the number of customers, she requires more beauty products, cosmetics, facial creams, etc. to cater to many customers at a time. For this, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

Bushra desires to expand her parlor and intends to spend part of the income on the improvement of her house.

Note: In the picture Bushra holds a passbook.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, cosmetics, facial creams, etc. for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jeziel

texts.en: Jeziel's main source of income comes from his gardening business. He is 22 years old and single. He is from San Juan, Panaon, and has been gardening for 2 years, earning an amount of about 3,200 PHP a month. This year, Jeziel joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en: Jenefer gains an income from her gardening production business. She is 28 years old and single with 1 child. She is from San Juan, Panaon, and has been gardening for 3 years, earning an amount of about 3,000 PHP a month. This year, Jenefer joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a single man. He describes himself as social and hard-working. Salim operates a grocery store where he sells fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, oranges, kale, etc. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as being the high prices of vegetables and fruits. 

Salim will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. His business goal is to operate another similar grocery store within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his living standard. This is Salim's second loan with SMEP DTM after taking out a previous loan of KES 20,000 which he managed to repay successfully .

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge and bread for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is an illiterate married man who could not find a job for many years. He therefore suffered in poverty until he discovered the secret of growing tomatoes, which always have a ready market. He has since bought himself a number of pieces of land and is now doing quite well growing tomatoes. 

He is now able to educate his children and has bought a simple grain milling machine. With this loan, he will buy tomato seeds, pesticides and mulch for the tomato garden. He hopes for a better livelihood for himself and family. He is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds, pesticides and mulch.

loans.name: Jovel

texts.en: Jovel is a 23-year-old resident of San Juan, Panaon. He helps provide his family's needs from the little amount of 5,000 PHP he gains monthly from his banana production business, which he has had for 2 years. This year he has been a member of GDMPC, and he is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-finance to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Jovel wants to make an expansion to his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a 30-year-old man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a greengrocery store where he sells tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a local residential area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the quick perishability of tomatoes, hence spoiling before they can be sold to customers. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase tomatoes. His business goal is to be a tomato distributor within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will improve his business with the help of SMEP DTM financial support. In addition, Erick does painting which increases his business income. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a chop bar (where African dishes are sold) at Dabir in Elmina. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been in her business for 3 years now. She is responsible for assisting her husband educate their children. Her loan will be used to buy cassava, bags of maize, rice and other ingredients to prepare her dishes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cassava, bags of maize, rice and other ingredients to prepare her dishes for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen started welding at a tender age after his parents failed to find tuition to pay for his high school. He mastered the art of welding and designing and is now good at fabricating windows and doors, which turn out to be beautiful. 

Although he started with nothing, he now boasts of a good house that he has yet to complete. He will use the money to buy metal frames for windows and doors for his incomplete residential house. He hopes the standard of living for his family members will improve with the support from Ugafode through the loan.

loans.use: To buy metal frames for doors and windows.

loans.name: Phidah

texts.en:
Phidah is a resident and a farmer in Kitale where she lives with her husband and children. She has been involved in farming activities for 22 years. Currently, Phidah supplies mainly the local market with maize, milk and poultry products which provide her with income for her family's upkeep.

Phidah has made a loan request amounting to 41,600 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to help her to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional dairy income will help boost her agricultural  business within the local market as well as easing her efforts to provide for her family's basic needs.

Phidah notes that farming business challenges are mainly animal diseases, inadequate rains and the high cost of farm inputs. However, she is confident that she will be able to improve her family's living standards through farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy scissors, razors, creams and shampoos and chairs for the barber shop

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is a 30-year-old married man. He has 2 children who are 10 and 13. He describes himself as honest, ambitious and courageous . He operates a retail business where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for 9 years. His business is located at a strategic business area and his primary customers are contractors. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the poor road network. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy building stones. His business goal is to rent another mining place so he can expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children with the profits he generates. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy building stones.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, is married and has four children. For the past 14 years, Marife has made a living as a rice farmer and earns about 8,000 PHP a month from her work. 

In 2009, Marife joined GDMPC. She is applying for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat is 47 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger in Hovd province, Mongolia. He is a hard-working and modest person. His wife, Tsengel, aged 46, works with her husband at a local market selling firewood and coal at retail prices. His son, Buyanbat, is a university student. 

Munhbat and Tsengel also work seasonally at construction sites during summer. They started their coal and firewood retail business in the local market in 2006. His oldest son has graduated from university, has married and lives separately. Munhbat is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay his other son's university tuition and other school fees.

loans.use: to pay his son's university tuition and other school fees

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is the mother of three children, with the first two already schooling. She is age thirty-two and has four consecutive years in farming within her rural home area in Kitale, Western Kenya. Her farm currently produces mainly milk and eggs for the local market. She also runs a salon business to supplement her farming income.

Rose has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to help her expand her poultry business by buying more birds. She says she enjoys her poultry business and strongly believes she will be able to expand even her dairy business.

Rose says the main challenge, however, remains the high cost of poultry feeds and outbreaks which call for proper management.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from the village of Bershueti, in the Gori district. She is 66 years old and a widow who lives alone. Her only source of income is her retirement pension. She owns agricultural land but was not able to cultivate it because of financial problems. 

Nino received a loan in the framework of a start-up program. She will start an agricultural business with the loan. She plans to cultivate the land and sow alfalfa (lucerne). After properly done agricultural work, Nino will get a good quality harvest and sell at a high price. This will significantly increase her income. She will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve her living conditions. Also, part of the additional profit will be used for financing the education of her grandchildren who live in the capital city. Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate a plot of land and sow lucerne (alfalfa).

loans.name: Teina

texts.en:
Teina is a widow and has been farming in her rural home area in Kitale where she lives with her three school-going children.

Teina has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the income will enable her to feed the family and educate her children. She remains optimistic that she will be able to grow her business with more dairy cows on the farm.

However, she notes that the high cost of animal feeds during the dry season remains a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene is 41 years of age and has 2 children, ages 20 and  23. She has been in the hotel business for the last 4 years and her business is in a quiet and viable business environment. She is the sole provider in her family where she caters for their financial needs, like paying school fees and housing bills. She plans to use the Kes 20,000 to purchase chairs and tables for her customers who turn up in large numbers. She sells her food to casual workers who are mansion and road contractors. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Magdalene describes herself as trustworthy and faithful woman.

loans.use: to buy restaurant furniture, such as chairs and tables.

loans.name: Cypriano

texts.en:
Cypriano is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children of school going age. He has been farming for thirteen years and runs his farm with the help of two farmhands. His farm produces coffee, tea, bananas and potatoes for the local markets.

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him construct a zero grazing unit for his dairy cows. He believes his milk production will be more improved and in turn improve the living standards of the family with the better income.

Cypriano says transportation and the high cost of animal feeds during dry seasons have been the major challenges.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Dolcas

texts.en:
Dolcas is aged 38 and has been involved in farming for seven consecutive years. Her main produce is tea which goes to the local market. She also produces milk for the local market. She is married with three children aged 13, 7 and 6 years who are all undertaking schooling.

Dolcas has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming. She notes that the returns from the poultry business are faster and the business has not be exploited by many farmers in the area. She says she will channel the major part of her income into educating her three children.

However, Dolcah notes poor prices for farm produce within the local markets as the major challenge in farming. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo supporting services to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Justino

texts.en:
Justino is from Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old,  is married and has one child. To make a living, Justino owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for six years and earns 8,500 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2011, Justino joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is a 60-year-old widow who lives in Surami with her son, daughter-in-law, grandson and retired mother-in-law. Several times, Makvala has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of her low income and the lack of experience in her new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly income earned by Makvala, who is involved in the food trading business. She buys pies from the local bakery and sells them at the railway station for a profit. According to the government's estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they get monthly social assistance.

Makvala requested a loan from Credo to start up her own business and sell clothing herself. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, for they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Makvala will purchase clothes for wholesale prices and resell them in her district for a profit. It will be hard work for Makvala, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the business to increase her stock and sales volume. Makvala awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 46 years old. She lives in Kutaisi District with her husband, 2 sons, daughter-in-law and an infant child. Manana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Manana works as a sales lady in a clothing store. She makes 250 GEL per month. It is hardly enough for food for her family. 

Manana requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With this loan, Manana will purchase clothes in Turkey for wholesale prices and resell them in her store for a profit. It will be hard work for Manana, but according to estimates, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in her business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to earn some savings and buy their own house. Manana awaits your support.

This new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a rural resident of Nkubu, and has been active in farming for 18 successive years. She has produced vegetables and milk, going to the local markets and providing for the family needs.

Damaris has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo which she will use to venture into poultry farming. She says this will help her have a more stable farming income, since the poultry business is not adversely affected by weather conditions, as are crops. She hopes to improve her family's living standards with the farming income, and educate her youngest child. She has three children, ages 25, 20, and 18.

She appreciates the Juhudi Kilimo staff for the training in managing a farm as a business. She notes crop failures, pests, and diseases as the major challenges, and the motivation to venture into poultry farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds for her new business venture.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед житель города Истаравшан. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Жена Чамшеда домохозяйка. Чамшед занимается производством и торговлей. Он плетет металлические сетки проволокой. Этим видом деятельности Чамшед занимается 7 лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения дополнительных инструментов и металлической проволоки.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 33 years old and is married with four children.  Jamshed's wife is a homemaker.  He works in the production and sale of wire mesh.  He has been in this line of work for seven years.  He is asking for a loan to buy additional tools and metal wire.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and metal wire

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a resident of Nkubu with 26 years of experience in mixed farming. She sells the major part of her produce, such as cabbages, tea, maize, and milk, within the local markets. She is a widow with 4 children; the youngest is the only one still in school.

Pamela has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her set a zero-grazing unit (confined area for lifestock, to prevent disease) and buy a chaff cutter (a machine that cuts hay into smaller pieces to be mixed with feed and fed to lifestock).  

She says her improved farming income will enable her to educate her youngest child.  She remains optimistic that she will eventually buy a vehicle to ease transportation of her produce to the market.

Pamela says lack of proper development for the local markets is a major challenge, coupled with pests and diseases.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit and buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a farmer and a father of four children aged between one and ten years. He has been in active farming for nine years and currently sells his products, which mainly include milk, horticultural and poultry products, to the local markets. Fred also retails cereals, mainly maize and beans, which he sources from other local farmers for additional income.

He has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He believes the acquisition of an additional dairy cow will help him meet his family's daily needs and pay for the education of his children with much ease.

Fred says lack of adequate feed during dry seasons and animal diseases remain his main challenges.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aminjon

texts.ru: Аминчон житель района Хамадони. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Аминчон работает таксистом. Он занимается частным извозом. Этим видом деятельности Аминчон занимается два года. Он берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Aminjon lives in the region of Hamadoni.  He is 27 years old and he is married with two children.  Aminjon works as a private taxi driver.  He has been in this line of work for two years.  He is asking for a loan to make repairs on his car.

loans.use: to buy new auto parts

loans.name: Mbar

texts.fr: Mbar est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il exerce un commerce de produits ménagers depuis près de 4 ans.Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d'entretenir sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter des sacs de savon en poudre (omo).Il ambitionne d'ouvrir une boutique de vente de produits ménagers.
texts.en:
Mbar is a married father of three children. He has been selling household products for nearly four years, which allows him to support himself and to provide for his family’s needs. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 150,000f to buy bags of powder detergent (Omo brand).

His goal is to open a store to sell household products.

loans.use: to buy bags of Omo powder detergent.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a resident of Kitale and has been farming for five years within her rural home area. Her main produce has been poultry and horticultural products. She also trades in secondhand clothes to supplement her farming income.

Regina has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She hopes to raise enough income to provide a better income and education for the children. She is widowed with three children.

She laments poultry diseases and the high cost of poultry feeds as her main challenges.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married, and has 3 children. She has received schooling through middle school. 

Aba sells second-hand clothing at Domenase, which she has done for 15 years. Her husband is a mason. Together with her husband, Aba uses her income to support their children. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase more second-hand clothing for resale. With the new profits, Aba plans to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business venture.

loans.name: Devaki

texts.en:
Devaki is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children aged 18 and 15. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Devaki plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Enver

texts.en:
Enver, 27, has been working in the kitchen of a restaurant for a very long time. He earns very low salary and now is planning to started his own business in agriculture. He plans to buy a cow in order to sell milk, cheese and other dairy products to earn a living. Enver is married and has two little girls aged three and five years old. 

He is now asking for a loan to buy a cow in order to start a small business in his area. This loan will help him to start his business. He hopes in the future to further expand his business to include a farm and to multiply the number of cows he owns. His goal is to improve the life of his family. He thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Maiya is 41 years old. She is married and has one child, age 16. In 2010, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods.  

In the future, Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: Omar est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il exerce le métier de menuisier et vend en meme temps du bois.Cette activité lui permet de générer des revenus assez consistants qui lui assure la prise en charge d'une partie des besoins de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter du bois de fabrication de meubles.Son ambition est de faire des voyages de commerce dans les pays de la sous région.
texts.en:
Omar is a married father of three children. He is a cabinet-maker who also sells wood, which allows him to earn substantial income that helps him to meet a good portion of his family’s needs. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 150,000f to buy wood to make furniture. 

His goal is to make business trips to the sub-regions.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Radha

texts.en:
Radha is 28 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 9 and 4. In 2010, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods.  

In the future, Radha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima is 48 years old. She is married and has 4 children, ages 26, 23, 22 and 18. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Sima plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Seoun

texts.en:
Seoun is a 34-year-old villager residing in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with two dependent kids, both of whom are too young for school. 

To earn a living, Seoun works in a rubber field while her husband farms rice to complement the family’s income. Together, this couple generates an income for the family of about 28,000KHR daily and saves about 10,000KHR after paying their daily expenses. 

Seoun has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already, with which she succeeded in meeting the needs of her family. She is now seeking a new loan with VisionFund of 3,000,000KHR to build a proper latrine for her family. Once the latrine is successfully installed, Seoun’s family will be able to live in a better and healthier environment, especially her young kids.
