She hopes that starting this new business will provide a good profit for her family and permit her to sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to earn extra income.

loans.name: Lo's Group

texts.en: Age 56 and the mother of four children, Lo is a local farmer originally from Bakan district of Pursat Province. She has met her family’s daily basic needs by growing rice on five hectares of farmland. Her husband not only helps her in the rice farm but also catches fish for additional income. She has been with her current business for 30 years, and she is able to earn about 28,800 KHR per day. In their first loan from VisionFund (Kiva's partner), she and her fellow group member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each.  The leader, Lo, is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer. She has great hopes that she can multiply her output and increase her income. In that way, she can make her living conditions better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Kar

texts.en:
A 29-year-old resident from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Kar is married and a mother of one schoolboy. She has managed five hectares of rice growing in order to provide the daily basic needs for the family. She has just engaged in this business for 1 year, earning about 15,000 KHR per day. 

Kar's past loan was an original loan from VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She has managed her first loan wisely to maintain good progress for her business as well as her living conditions. Now, she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that this purchase will help to grow more rice and make her income triple. She hopes she can keep her only son in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor costs.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Ren, 50, is a villager living in the rural village of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province in Cambodia. She is married and has six children, four (one daughter and three sons) of whom are dependent on her. To continually support her family, Ren has been working so tirelessly as a rice farmer for more than 25 years, earning about 24,000 KHR per day. Ren has been a member of VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for one loan cycle already, with which she relieved the burdens of her family. Now she is in need of money to buy fertilizer to support her rice field. Thus, she is leading a group member named Neng, who is a first-time borrower with VisionFund, to take out a loan of 1,200,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. The group representative, Ren, believes that via the help of her loan, her business will provide a good-quality crop that she can sell for more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ron

texts.en: Ron, 47 years old, is a citizen residing in a rural area of Kandal Stoeng district in Kandal province, Cambodia. She is married and a mother of seven children. Two of Ron's children are currently in school. This hard-working mother supports her family by selling grocery items such as canned goods, sugar, salt, shampoo, soap, etc. This is Ron's second time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The first loan that she already received and paid back completely enabled her to buy more grocery items in order to satisfy her customers. Now Ron is applying for a USD 500 loan with VisionFund to purchase a motorbike for her children to use for commuting. Ron would like to dedicate all of her efforts to advancing her children's education as much as possible.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Lyna's Group

texts.en:
Nineteen-year-old Lyna lives in a rural area of Ek Phnom district in Cambodia's Battambang province. She is married and has one dependent son. 

To offer a decent life for her family, Lyna works as a tailor and a grocery seller, while her husband complements the income by working as a paid worker. Together they are able to earn approximately 58,000 KHR per day and save about 12,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. 

Lyna is leading a loan group of two female members, both of whom are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), to take out a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 KHR in total. This young mother will use her first-time requested loan portion, which is 700,000 KHR, as working capital to support her grocery-selling business by buying more canned items, sugar, salt, instant noodles, etc. in order to meet her customers’ satisfaction. 

With her loan portion, Lyna believes that she will be able to satisfy her customers and gain more income for the family. Then she can use the anticipated income to move her family ahead and send her son to a good school in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned items, sugar, salt, instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
Rin, a 49-year-old married father, lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. He has five dependent children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. 

To make a living, he has been farming rice for 12 years, though sometimes he works for others for a fee. Rin can earn about KHJR 13,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 8,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses.
 
Rin has been with VisionFund for two cycles, while his group member has been with VisionFund for three.. Rin fully paid back his past loans, which have helped his family with enough food. 

Now he is leading his group of two to apply for another loan. He is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland and a portion of it to spend on buying piglets to raise to earn additional income. He hopes to grow his rice healthfully so as to improve his standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Yuth

texts.en: Residing in a rural village of Sangke district in Cambodia's Battambang province, Yuth is a 53-year-old married woman with seven children, one (a son) of whom is dependent on her and currently in school. Yuth has been working so hard to earn the resources needed for the family. She has two businesses farming rice on a five-hectare plot of farmland and raising six heads of cattle. To add extra income to the family, Yuth's husband also operates a pineapple-planting business. Together, they are able to earn around 12 USD per day. Yuth has been a member of VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for one loan already, with which she expanded her plot of farmland and boosted the family's income as well. Now, in hope of earning even greater income for the family, Yuth is applying for a USD 400 loan to purchase fertilizer to keep her rice-growing business and her husband's pineapple-planting business in good shape. Yuth is so excited that she has an opportunity to be able to access this loan via VisionFund because she believes that with the help of this loan, she will be able to produce a good quality crop that she can sell for more profit. She is also willing to use the anticipated profit to advance the education of her school-aged child as well as improve the living standard of her beloved family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Net's Group

texts.en:
Net, a 31-year-old married mother, lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, Net has been working as a paid garment worker for 12 years while her husband works as a construction worker in the local area to earn additional income for the family. The current business earns her family approximately 60,000 KHR per day. She manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Net has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. She has wisely used the past loan to better support her living conditions. Now Net is leading her group of two to seek another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy construction materials for her husband’s business. She hopes to earn more income from the current business to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her husband’s business

loans.name: Sakun's Group

texts.en:
Sakun is 33 years old and single. She lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. The main source of her family’s income is from faming rice, watermelon and cucumber. Sakun has been in this business for ten years. Sometimes she catches fish to supplement her income. Her daily income is approximately 50,000 KHR, and she can manage to save about 10,000 KHR after offsetting her daily expenses. 

Sakun’s group consists of two members, who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Sakun completely paid back the past loan, which helped her better support her business. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. Sakun wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cultivated land. She hopes to get a high yield from her plantation business so as to better her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her cultivated land

loans.name: Sangao

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district, Sangao is 62 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Sangao and her husband have been farming rice on one hectare of farmland. This has been their primary business for two years. Sangao also raises chickens in a local area to earn extra income. 

Sangao is in her first microloan with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. She wants to use her loan to buy feed for her chickens and use a portion of the loan to buy household supplies for her family. Through this loan, she hopes to fatten her chickens so che can sell them for a good price in order to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and household supplies for her family

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Savet is 34 years old and married. She is the mother of two children, both of whom are still too young for school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on three hectares of farmland for six years. They supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. They are able to earn about 62,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

Savet has been with VisionFund for three cycles and successfully paid back the past loans. Savet has used her previous loans to better support her family with enough food. She is now requesting a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR to renovate her old tractor. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully so as to better her standard of living and send her children to school.

loans.use: To renovate her old tractor

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ban's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Ban is the 40-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her; two are still in school while one is too young. 

The main sources of family’s income are rice farming and cassava planting, which she and her husband have been in for 20 years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 26,000 per day, and she can save about KHR13,000 each day after daily expenses.

Ban’s group consists of two members who live in the same village.  She has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely repaid her loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve its livelihood. 

Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. Ban will use her potion to buy a decent tractor to help her in the farming business. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice and cassava timely and fruitfully so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a decent tractor to help her on her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
A native of a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Non is the 49-year-old mother of five children, one of whom depends on her and is still in school. 

Rice farming and pig raising have been the main sources of her family’s income for 27 years. The current business earns her about KHR 23,000 per day, and she manages to save about KHR 12,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Non has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely repaid her loans, which helped her to improve her family’s living condition. Now she is requesting a loan of KHR 2,400,000. She is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rady

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Ou Reang Ov district of Cambodia, Rady is 43 years old and married, with two children who are still in school.  

She and her husband are hard-working farmers who earn a living farming rice. To add more income, she also buys and sells rice in her local area. They have been in this business for 20 years.

Rady is in her first cycle with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of US$500. With this loan, she is going to buy more rice to resell. 

She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is 28 years old and married. She and her family reside in Pursat province's Bakan district, Cambodia. She has two sons, both of whom are under her responsibility. Sophy and her husband earn a living by farming rice, the business in which she has been involved for eight years. They earn around 15,000 KHR per day. 

This is Sophy's second time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Sophy was able to boost her income and improve the living standard of her family with the help of the previous loan, which she completely paid back already. 

This time, she is applying for a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. With this new requested loan, Sophy will use some portion of it for purchasing fertilizer and use the other portion of the loan for covering household expenses. 

After receiving and wisely using her loan, Sophy believes that her business will provide better quality crop yields, so that she can sell them for greater profit. Sophy will also use the anticipated profit to send her sons to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Youn's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of one daughter who is still in school, Youn is 56 years old and lives in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. 

To support the family, she and her husband farm rice on three hectares of farmland as the main source of family’s income; they have been in this business for ten years. Her current business earns her about KHR 10,000 per day, and she is able to save about KHR 4,000 each day.

Youn is in her first cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay labor fees and a portion to buy household supplies for her family. 

She hopes to earn a large income from the rice paddy to make a good living and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor and buy household supplies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Yam

texts.en:
Yam is 36 years old and married with two children, both of whom are students. She lives in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district, in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia.

Yam and her husband work as rice farmers and paid workers in order to offer a decent life for their family. Together, they are able to earn around 20,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day. 

Yam is a first-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to purchase fertilizer and two buffalo in order to help run her rice-growing business more smoothly. Via the help of this loan, she expects to see an improvement in the rice-growing business as well as in her family's living conditions. Yam also hopes that she will be able to advance her children's education as far as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and two buffalo.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Loun

texts.en:
Loun is a 44-year-old farmer who lives with her husband in a rural area of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has ten children, seven of whom are dependents. Some are still in school and some help in the family business. 

Loun grows rice on four hectares of farmland and also raises pigs. Having been in this business for 18 years, she is able to earn about 10,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day and manages to save about 3,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.
 
This is Loun’s first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR. Loun wants to use this loan to buy piglets to raise and sell them for a good price to improve her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal is age 25 and a married mother of four children, living in a rural village of the Sampov district, Pursat province. All of her children are still in school. Rice farming, cassava planting and pig raising are the main sources of the family’s income, and her husband supplements family income by working as a laborer. They have been in these businesses for two years. Sophal and her husband earn about KHR 27,000 per day, and they manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day, after daily living expenses.

Sophal’s group consists of three members. Sophal has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and successfully paid back the past loan. The past loan helped her to support her current farming business. Now she is leading her group to request another loan. Sophal, who is the leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy more piglets and feed for her pig business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn a good living.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and feed, for her pig business

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Phnom Kror Vanh district in the Pursat province, Pov is a 31-year-old mother of two children. They both are dependents and still in school. The main source of the family’s income for the past several years has been is rice farming. Her husband supplements her income by working for others for a fee. With her current business, she and her husband can earn about KHR 39,000 per day, and can save about KHR 15,000 each day after covering their daily expenses.

Pov's group consists of three members who live in the same village. This is her first microloan from VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Pov will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow a lot of rice to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Pursat province, Phnom Kror Vanh district

loans.name: Thatt

texts.en:
Thatt is aged 36 and lives in a rural area of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been struggling to feed her children by farming rice on 2.5 hectares and she has been in this business for ten years. Thatt is able to earn about KHR10,000 per day. 

This is the second microloan for Thatt with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her to relieve her family’s burden. Now she is applying for a loan of US$1,000. She wants to use this loan to build a decent house. Thatt hopes this loan will enable her to have proper house for living in.

loans.use: To build a decent house

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kror Kor district of the Pursat province, Sopheap is a 30-year-old mother of three children. They are dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming has been their main source of income for three years. Her husband also supplements the income by making palm juice. The current business earns her family about 19,000 KHR per day, from which they can save about 10,000 KHR each day after covering daily expenses.
Sopheap is just starting with VisionFund this cycle while the other member has already been with VisionFund for one cycle. Sopheap, who is the leader, will use her portion to pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: A 45-year-old single woman, Chantha resides in a rural area of Kror Kor district located in Pursat province in Cambodia. Chantha earns her living through farming rice and selling grocery items, businesses in which she has been involved for more than ten years, earning around 11,000KHR and saving approximately 5,000KHR after cancelling out her daily expenses. Chantha has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for two loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in securing food needs and securing her current businesses as well. Now she is leading a loan group of two female members to take out a loan in the amount of 700,000KHR each. As a group representative, Chantha will utilize her loan portion in this loan to purchase fertilizer to support her rice field and more grocery items to sell. Chantha, after receiving her loan portion and using it as she plans, believes that she can boost her income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Sarout

texts.en:
Sarout is 32 years old and lives in a rural area of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia.  She is married with three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

The main source of family’s income is cassava planting on four hectares of farmland.  She has been in this business for five years to make a living. The current business earns her about KHR 10,000 per day to meet family’s needs. 

This is Sarout’s first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan with VisionFund of KHR 3,000,000. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her cassava planting. She hopes to earn more income from the crop yield business so as to improve her family standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her cassava planting.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is a villager living in a rural area of Srey Snom district located in Cambodia's Siem Reap province. She is 51 years old and married with four children, two (sons) of whom are school-aged children and still dependent on her. To offer a decent life for her family, she has been working tirelessly as a rice farmer for 10 years on a three-hectare plot of farmland. She earns around 10,000 KHR per day and saves approximately 5,000 KHR after deducting her daily cost of living. Ly is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for the first time. With this loan, she will buy a motorbike and a tractor. With the help of this loan, Ly hopes that she can earn a larger income from her current business. She is also willing to use the anticipated income to move her family ahead and help her children further their education.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a tractor.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sakey's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Pursat province’s KrorKor district, Sakey is 60 years old and widowed. She has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer who has been growing rice on two hectares. She has been in this business for twenty years and can earn about 10,000 KHR per day from the current business.

Sakey has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans. The other member of this group has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now Sakey is leading her group of two, to seek a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, each person. As the leader, Sakey will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to get a high yield from her rice paddy, so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kror kor district, Pursat province of Cambodia, Ny is 30 years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are dependent and still in school. Ny has been in the business of selling fish and vegetables for almost ten years, while her husband farms rice and works for others for a wage. The current businesses earn her family a total of about 37,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily living expenses. 

Ny’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. This is the first loan cycle for Ny with VisionFund. Ny is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy a buffalo, for raising and for helping her in farm work. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income, so as to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo, for raising and for helping her with the farm work

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Kror Kor district in the Pursat province of Cambodia, Roen is a 25-year-old married mother of one son who is still too young for school. She and her husband have struggled to make a living by farming rice, raising pigs and working for others for several years. Together, they can earn approximately KHR 25,000 per day to meet family’s needs. 

Roen has been with VisionFund for two cycles while the other member started with VisionFund this cycle. Roen has completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to to buy household supplies. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy piglets and pig feed. She hopes to earn more income from the current business to improve her living conditions and set aside money to send her son to school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 40-year-old, married man with 6 children who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has gone through some hardships in his life. However, because of his dedication and desire to get ahead in life, he has been able to overcome these difficulties and make progress, together with his family. He owns a grocery store where he offers basic consumer goods for sale. He has been operating his business for seven years. He started his business with a small retail shop, and he expanded his it until it became a grocery store. 

Recently, his inventory of merchandise has diminished considerably. With the intention of increasing the quantity of products that he offers, he wants to buy more food products to display for his customers. However, he does not have enough capital to make all of these purchases. For this reason, he requested a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB. This loan will allow him to buy grocery items like canned food, spices, and soft drinks. In the future, he would like to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy canned food, spices, soft drinks and other groceries for his business.

loans.name: Sopheary

texts.en:
Sopheary, 27, is married and has two children--one school aged child and one young little child.  He supports his family as an electrician while his wife is a house painter.  He is able to earn up to 11 USD from the current business which he has been engaged in for 3 years. 

Including this loans, he has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund for four times.  His past loans have helped his business and have given backed to him a good return.  Moreover, his living condition is getting better day by day.  Now, he is seeking for 1,000 USD to buy a decent motorbike for commuting back and forth to his work place.  He hopes that this purchase will help him to minimize the expenses related to transportation. Thereby, he can use the money saved from his transportation costs to cover his children's education instead.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike

loans.name: Aem

texts.en:
Aem is residing in a rural village of Kandal Stoeng district located in Kandal province, Cambodia. He is 28 years of age and married. Aem is also a father of a daughter and a son, both of whom are school-aged children and still dependent on him. 

To earn a decent life for the family, Aem and his wife work as tailors. In order to add more income to the family, Aem also has a business farming rice, in which he has been involving for six years. The current businesses that Aem operates have enabled him to earn around 7 USD per day. 

This will be Aem's second time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The first loan that he obtained and successfully paid back helped him improve the living conditions of his family. This time, he is applying for a USD 700 loan with VisionFund. 

Aem intends to utilize this loan to buy a motorbike for commuting. After receiving and using the loan as he plans, Aem believes that he will be able to commute to the place where he operates his businesses faster and easier.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
As one of the breadwinners in the family,  Phorn is originally from Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province.  He is 36 years old and has two children. 

To secure his daily food, he works at a construction site and grows rice while his wife works at the factory nearby their house.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years. This is the fifth-cycle loan for Phorn with VisionFund (Kiva's partner).  After the successful loans which he repaid with success, he feels confident that he can improve his family's living condition and support his children's education. 

Now, he is applying for a new loan to purchase an additional plot of farmland to expand his rice paddy growing business.  He hopes this purchase will help him to grow more rice on a bigger scale and return him double profits.  With that, he can support his children's education up to a higher level.

loans.use: To purchase an additional plot of farmland

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en: Rat, a citizen from the Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap Province, is 65 years old and has three children. She is a widow who makes a living selling groceries. For the 10 years that she has been involved in this business, she has been able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day. Rat's group consists of two female members, who are second-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has successfully repaid her first loan, which supported her family and her business. Now, she and her co-group member are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy two pigs to raise. She hopes to raise healthy pigs so she can sell them at a high price so she has the income to maintain her living condition.

loans.use: To buy two pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Am's Group

texts.en: Am is 49 years old and a mother of three children who are still in school. To meet their family's needs, she and husband grow rice and raise pigs. She has been in this business for 15 years, and she is able to earn about 6,000 KHR per day. Am's group consists of four members: three females and one male. Am is a first-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, and she is the leader of the group. She is seeking 500,000 KHR while her remaining three co-borrowers are requesting 800,000 KHR each. Am is going to use her portion to buy one additional pig to raise. She hopes to earn more income from both her both businesses and to make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy a pig to raise.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan, a divorced mother of three children, is 35 years old and living in a rural village in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap, Cambodia. As of now, all of her children are dependent on her, as two are still in school and one is helping with the family's business. She has struggled for her children through paddy cropping and grocery selling. For the 5 years that she has been involved in this business, she has been able to earn up to 25,000 KHR per day. This is Chan's fourth time with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The previous loans have gradually supported both her businesses and made her a good income, as well as some savings. With her effort, she was able to buy a decent motorbike to support her business. Now she is seeking 1000 USD to buy more grocery items, including canned food, soap, and shampoo, for resale. She hopes to earn more income so that she can continue to make her living.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for resale.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Ley is 44 years old and married. She has four children in total, two schoolchildren and two who are paid workers.

Ley's main business is paddy rice cultivation, which she has been doing for ages and is able to earn up to 26,300 KHR per day. Ley's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) was five loan cycles ago, which she has repaid with success, and it better supported her business and helped her keep up a good standard for her living conditions.

Now, she forms a group of three to seek a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy an additional plot of farmland for growing rice. She hopes to make more income from her business so she can keep her two children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun is 26 and lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of the Pursat province in Cambodia. She is married. Sinoun has been struggling to feed her children by farming rice on five hectares and raising pigs. She has been in this business for three years. Sinoun is able to earn about KHR 23,000 per day. 
This is the first microloan for Sinoun’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy pig feed for her pig business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed.

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet, a rural citizen from Bakan district of Pursat province, is 27 years old and a married mother of three children.  Her main source of income is from a grocery selling business which she has been running for 8 years.

To supplements the income, her husband grows rice.  She is able to earn up to 23,100 KHR per day.  Samet has never been with VisionFund before.  She is seeking a 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy mini-tractor to support her husband's business, growing rice.  She hopes this purchase will help her to save time in plowing their farm, so that she can have more time to take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy mini-tractor

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
A local farmer, originally from Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Hun is a mother of a huge family consisting of 10 children.  Currently, only four children still need her support as three of them are still in school and a remaining one is helping the family business. 

She has struggled to survive her daily living through rice farming on two hectares of farmland.  Hun just joined VisionFund (Kiva's partner) this cycle.  She is seeking a 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy dishes, bowls, and pots for resale for extra income.  She hopes that this purchase will help her to make extra income so as she can keep her three children in school.

loans.use: To buy dishes, bowls, and pots for resale

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap, a married mother of seven children, is a citizen from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province (Cambodia).  Her main source of income is from rice planting on six hectares of farmland.  Having been with this business for 3 years, she is able to earn up to 34,700 KHR per day. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund(Cambodia), including this cycle.  Her past loan has provided her sufficient working capital for her business and returned her with a satisfyingly high crop output.  For her past loan, she has successfully repaid back the loan already.  Now, she is seeking 1,500,000 KHR loan.  She is going to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her farmland and a portion of it to buy grocery items for resale for extra income.  She hopes to earn double the income from both of her businesses so she can keep improving her standard of living and set aside some money to start a new business for even greater income.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath, age 38, is married and has two schoolchildren.  She supports her household by selling grocery items while her husband supplements the family's income through rice farming. 

She has been engaged in this business for 4 years. Sambath is a fourth-time borrower and joins a group with another member who is a third-time borrower to apply for a new loan with VisionFund,Kiva's partner.  The past loan that she has completely paid back has supported her business with a decent income.  As a result, she can keep her kids in school. 

For this cycle, both of them are seeking for the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy additional grocery items for resale, including canned food, instant noodle, duck eggs, etc... She hopes this purchase will restock her grocery items for timely resale and to get back a good profit for her family's sake.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items

loans.name: Se

texts.en:
Se is a rural villager from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is married and has four children. Rice farming and grocery selling are the main sources of her family's income, and she has worked for 15 years in order to provide for her family's daily necessities.

She is a seven-cycle loan client with VisionFund. Her past loans, which she has repaid successfully, relieved her family's burdens and replaced them with a standard lifestyle.

Now she is seeking a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR. She is going to use this to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to make more income from this business so she can keep making her living conditions better.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale

loans.name: Deab

texts.en:
A 41-year-old seller in the local market located in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Deab is married and has four children. Currently she needs to care for two children, as they are still in school. To tackle the financial difficulty in the family, she sells various kinds of prepared food including dried fish, smoked fish, sausage, and fish-paste. This has been her only business for 10 years. 

Deab's first loan with VisionFund (a Kiva partner) was three cycles ago. She has wisely used her past loans to maintain her standard of living, and she has repaid them successfully too. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy dried fish, smoked fish, fish-paste, and salt fish for resale. She hopes this purchase will replenish her stock and attract more clients, so she can make more income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy dried fish, smoked fish, fish-paste, and salt fish for resale

loans.name: Sol

texts.en: A rural resident of Kandal province's Kandal Stoeng district, Sal is 56 years old and a married father blessed with three children. To overcome the family’s financial burden arising from the daily cost of living, he drives a motor-taxi for a fee. Each day, he is able to earn almost 9 USD, but can afford to save only 3 USD after deducting all expenses. Sal is a third-time borrower with Kiva partner VisionFund. He is seeking a loan of 200 USD which he will combine with his savings in order to buy a small computer for his children. He hopes that his purchase will help his children to learn basic computer skills and maintain their good performance at school.

loans.use: To buy a small computer for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an assortment of products.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
A divorced mother with four children living in a rural area located in Kror Kor district of Cambodia, Pha is 52 years old and earns a living through rice farming. The business that she has engaged in for 10 years earns her about 14,600 KHR per day. 

Pha is with VisionFund(Cambodia) for the first time and is applying for a 3,000,000 KHR loan.  She will use this huge amount of loan to buy a mini-tractor in order to support her farmland. She hopes that this purchase will help her to spend less time in plowing her farmland so as she can save the money which she used to spend on labor cost for plowing.

loans.use: To buy a mini-tractor in order to support her farmland

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: Son tres socias emprendedoras, una de ellas es Keylin que se dedica a vender ropa, trastes de plásticos, cosméticos  de forma ambulante tiene más de 3 años de ejercer esa actividad, tiene tres hijos menores y su esposo le ayuda en el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos Avon, trastes de plásticos y ropa. Alejandra tiene una mini librería además vende gaseosa y Sonia vende comida en su domicilio.
texts.en:
These three women are entrepreneurial communal bank members, one of whim is Keylin.  She works selling clothing, plastic dishes, and cosmetics as a walking vendor. She has more than three years of experience working in this business. She has three minor children, and her husband helps her in the business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of Avon cosmetics, plastic dishes, and clothing. 

Alejandra has a little bookshop and also sells soft drinks, and Sonia sells food in her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, plastic dishes, and a variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Sokcha

texts.en:
Sokchea, age 48, has five children and is a resident of Kror Kor district of Pursat Province.  To combat the family's financial hardship, she runs a small stall for selling vegetables, fishes, and meat while her husband grows rice and raises chickens. 

For five years experience in this business, she is able to earn up to 15,000 KHR per day.  This is the first-cycle loan for Sokha with VisionFund(Kiva's partner).  She is seeking a 1,000,000 KHR loan.  A portion of her loan will be used to buy more chickens and to build a chicken coop and some portion of it will be used to purchase more items to replenish her grocery store.  She hopes that she can earn more income from her various businesses so she can sustain her living condition in a good way.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and grocery items

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Thoeurn is 35 years old and married.  He has five children, only three of whom still count on him as some of them are still in school. 

He and the rest of his family are living in a local area of Pursat Province's Bakan district where rice farming is a popular business for him as well as for his neighborhood.  He has been engaged in his rice cultivation for 18 years, earning about 21,200 KHR per day.  For him, the lack of working capital for supporting his business is the main challenge. Therefore, he forms a group of three members to apply for a new loan.  As the first-time borrowers, he and one of his co-members are seeking for a loan of 500,000 KHR each while a remaining member is applying for 700,000 KHR. 

For Thoeurn, as the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farm.  He highly hopes that this purchase will boost his crop productivity and return him a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: William De Jesús

texts.es: William de 52 años de edad, vive con su madre y sus dos hijos de 16 y 17 años. Desde su juventud se ha dedicado a la tienda de abarrotes que heredó de su padre, el cual se convirtió en el sustento para su casa. Desea poderle ofrecer a sus hijos educación universitaria, pero es consciente que su tienda no proporciona los ingresos suficientes para ofrecerles a sus hijos la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad. Debido a esta situación William se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito para comprar surtido y generar mayores ingresos con los que espera poder hacer realidad los sueños de sus hijos.
texts.en: William is 52 years old and lives with his mother and two children, ages 16 and 17.  Since he was a youth, he has run the business that he inherited from his father, which has become the main income for the household.  He wants to be able to offer his children a university education, but he is conscious of the fact that his business does not currently provide enough of an income to offer his children the ability to begin taking classes.  Because of this, William is looking for a loan to buy merchandise and generate a higher income with which he hopes to make his children's dreams a reality.

loans.use: to purchase rice, potatoes, beans and whole cane sugar for his store

loans.name: Soul's Group

texts.en:
Soul, a 49-year-old mother of one son, resides in a rural village located in the Bakan district of Pursat province. To survive with her daily basic needs, she is a rice farmer and raises pigs with strong support from her husband. She is able to earn up to 7,100 KHR (Cambodian riles) per day from the business that she been with for 30 years. 

In a group of two as a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), Soul and her co-borrower are seeking 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy potash for her farm. She hopes this purchase will multiply her crop yield so she can double her income.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farm.

loans.name: Sas' Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Phnom Kror Vanh district of Pursat Province, Sas is 58 years old and a widowed mother of four children. She secures her daily cost of living through rice farming, fish raising and grocery selling. She has been with these businesses for 20 years and they enable her to earn up to 27,600 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Sas has never been with VisionFund before; the same as her other two co-borrowers who are in the same group of three members. She and one of her fellow group members are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each, while her remaining co-member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice crop and to buy additional grocery items such as soap, food ingredient, canned food, etc. She hopes this purchase will help her to support her businesses on time and get her back to a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and grocery items.

location.town: Pursat province, Phnom Kror Vanh district

loans.name: Leangheng's Group

texts.en:
Leangheng lives in a rural area in Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province.  She is 26 years old and the young mother of two schoolchildren. 

Getting by mainly depends on her one hectare of rice cultivation. She is able to earn up to KHR 13,000 from her rice paddy, which she has farmed for several years. 

The lack of working capital for supporting her paddy is a main challenge. To overcome this challenge, she formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. As first-time borrowers, she and her co-borrower are seeking KHR 400,000 and KHR 800,000, respectively. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She highly expects that she can grow her rice with a triple output and make more income for the sake of her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
Don José tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene seis hijos. Desde muy temprana edad, empezó a trabajar cono jornalero, al paso del tiempo emprendió el oficio de la carpintería y se caso. Su familia, es muy unida, tienen buena reputación en la comunidad donde vive, fue miembro del comité de crédito en su comunidad. Es uno de los mejores carpinteros de su comunidad y de esos ingresos es que le proporciona el estudio a sus hijos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 30 bolsas de cemento, 5 polines de hierro, 3 camionadas de arena, hierro y para pago de mano de obra; para la construcción de su vivienda, el préstamo le ayudara a completar el dinero que le falta para realizar la construcción.  Con el crédito podrá terminar de construir la vivienda, para que su familia se sienta más cómoda y segura. Entre sus sueños están, el continuar mejorando su vivienda, mejorar su carpintería comprando más equipo y herramientas.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old, is married, and has six children. When he was very young, José started working as a day laborer; with time he took on carpentry and got married. His family is close-knit and they have a good reputation in the community where they live. He used to be a member of the loan committee in his community. José is one of the best carpenters there, and with the income from this activity he can afford his children’s education.

The loan he requested from Fundación Campo is intended to buy 30 cement sacks, 5 iron skids, 3 truckloads of sand, and iron, as well as to pay workers in order to build a house for himself. The loan will help him obtain the amount needed to finish construction. With this loan he can finish building the house so that his family will be more comfortable and safe. His dreams include continuing his home improvements and developing his carpentry workshop by buying more equipment and tools.

loans.use: to buy 30 cement sacks, 5 iron skids, 3 truckloads of sand, and iron, as well as to pay workers in order to build his house.

loans.name: Luis Libardo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la cálida ciudad de Imperial al lado de sus 2 hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad, a quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes lucha cada día, ya que él es padre soltero, el se ha convertido en madre y padre apara sus hijos, ya que debido a algunos problemas la madre de sus hijos lo abandono. Desde ese momento no le ha sido muy fácil el sacarlos adelante pero gracias al amor que les tiene y sobre todo porque cada día ellos son su razón más grande para vivir.  Luis es muy trabajador, día a día se gana el sustento para su familia trabajando como ayudante en una imprenta de su ciudad, pero cuando se acerca el mes de la navidad, el elabora panetones para esta fecha con lo cual obtiene un dinero extra con lo cual puede brindarles una navidad alegre a sus hijos a pesar de lo humilde que es. 

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar insumos para poder elaborar panetones como mantequilla, harina en saco, pasa, frutas confitadas, entre otros; de esta manera el podrá elaborar sus productos y mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una panadería, una imprenta y poder darle a sus hijos una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Luis is 42 years old. He lives in the warm city of Imperial with his two children aged 12 and 6 years. He loves his children very much and struggles on a daily basis for their sake. Because he's a single father, he has become both a mother and a father to his children. Due to some problems, the mother of his children left him. Ever since then it hasn't been easy for him to get them ahead, but he does it because of the love he has for them and especially because they're his biggest reason for living each day. Luis is very hardworking. Every day he supports his family by working as an assistant at a print shop in his town. However, when Christmas season approaches, he makes panettones (sweet bread) for this holiday. That way he earns some extra money in order to provide a merry Christmas for his children despite how humble he is.
Luis is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he'll be able to purchase supplies such as butter, sacks of flour, raisins, candied fruit, etc., so that he can make panettones. That way he'll be able to make his pastries and increase his earnings. Thus he'll keep on fighting to make his biggest dream come true: "Owning a bakery and a print shop, and being able to provide his children with a good education and better living conditions".

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making panettones (sweet bread).

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la calidad ciudad de Chincha junto a su esposa y sus 2 pequeños hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad, Carlos es un padre amoroso y sobre todo muy luchador, desde pequeño aprendió lo que es ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres eran de condición muy humilde y en ocasiones sus ingresos no les alcanzaban para los gastos del hogar y es por ello que Carlos trabajaba para poder ayudarlos. Con el pasar del tiempo Carlos solo pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria. 

Día a día Carlos trabaja como chofer en una empresa, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gatos de su hogar; el  cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo cumplido con su trabajo.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado el  podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como refacción de paredes construcción de fachada, pintado y instalaciones de tuberías de agua, con lo cual podrá brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y así poder luchar por conseguir hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa y poder brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación”.
texts.en:
Carlos, 34, lives in the warm city of Chincha with his wife and two children who are 15 and 8 years of age.  Carlos is a loving father who above all is very tenacious.  Since he was a boy he learned how to earn his livelihood with the sweat of his brow since his parents were of humble means and sometimes their income was insufficient to cover household expenses so Carlos worked to help them out.  As time passed, Carlos was able to finish his secondary education but would have liked to have gone to university.

Carlos works day to day as a driver for a firm.  He works about 8 hours daily and is able to cover household expense with the fruits of his labor.  He believes he does well at work because he’s very responsible and above all conscientious about his work.

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to do some home improvements like repair walls, build the façade, paint and install water pipes to provide his family with better quality of life and he can continue working towards making his greatest dream reality: to finish building his house and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Fiorella Yenefer

texts.es:
Fiorella es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres en la calurosa y alegre ciudad de Chincha, Fiorella es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella estudia actualmente la carrera de derecho en una de las universidades de su ciudad y para poder apoyarse con los gastos de sus estudios ella trabaja vendiendo ropa a sus compañeros de clase, vecinos y amigos de su barrio; ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día ya que por las noches va a su centro de estudios; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy carismática y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Fiorella está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como como short, pantalones, blusas, polos, entre otros y de esta manera tener mas mercadería y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes,de esta manera ella seguirá luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio, culminar su carrera y poder seguir apoyando a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Fiorella, 21, lives with her parents in the hot, cheerful city of Chincha.  Fiorella is a young woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s currently studying Law at a local university and to help pay for her studies she works selling clothes to her classmates, neighbors and local friends.  She works about 8 hours daily because she attends classes at night.  She believes she does well in her business because she’s kind to all the customers and above all because she’s charismatic and very much wants to get ahead.

Fiorella is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy more merchandise like shorts, pants, blouses, shirts, etc. for the business and thus have more merchandise and offer a wider variety to her customers.  In this way, she will continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to have her own store, to finish her career and to continue supporting her parents.

loans.use: to buy shorts, pants, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Diana Estela

texts.es:
Diana tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de cuatro meses de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio junto a su abuela desde hace cinco años; su mamá se caso con otra persona y se fue de la casa; por eso Diana se quedo con su abuela y su esposo. Ella junto a su esposo instalaron una tienda de productos básicos, a la cual tratan de surtirla cada día, ya que desean brindar una buena atención a sus clientes. Para comprar los productos para su tienda, debe viajar a la ciudad, para eso camina  a pie unos treinta minutos, luego aborda el autobús que la conduce a la ciudad y tarda cuarenta minutos para llegar y luego regresarse a su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un quintal de fríjol, un quintal de azúcar, un quintal de arroz, dos garrafas de aceite, tres cajas de jabón, rinso, lejía y la otra parte para instalar la luz eléctrica en su casa. Actualmente, Diana traslada luz de la casa de su abuela hacia la casa de ella; pero lo ideal es que ella lo tenga solo para ella, además que comprara más productos, pues cada día los clientes demandan más productos y mejor atención a sus necesidades. Su objetivo es ahorrar, para comprarse un terreno y construir su casa, donde vive es de un familiar. Por otra parte desea que su negocio prospere para que sus vecinos no viajen a la ciudad en busca de productos; sino que los puedan adquirir en su tienda. Todo esfuerzo que realiza , es con la única finalidad de brindar a su hijo alimentación, salud, vestuario y educación.
texts.en:
Diana, 24, is married and has a four-month-old son.  She and her grandmother have been merchants for five years.  Her mother remarried and left home which is why Diana lives with her grandmother and her husband.  She and her husband set up a grocery store that they try to stock every day because they want to provide good customer service.  To buy products for their store, she must travel to the city and to do so she first walks for half an hour to catch a bus that takes her to the city; it takes 40 minutes to get there and then she has to make the return trip home.

Part of the loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy a quintal of beans, a quintal of sugar, a quintal of rice, two large jugs of oil, three boxes of soap, RInso [brand of detergent] and lye and the other part is to install electricity at home.  Diana currently transfers electricity from her grandmother’s house to hers but the ideal thing is for her to have her own.  She will also buy more products because customers demand more things every day to better meet their needs.  Her goal is to save up to buy a lot to build a house because where she lives now belongs to a relative.  On the other hand, she hopes her business will prosper so that her neighbors won’t have to travel to the city seeking products but will be able to buy them in her store.  All her efforts are aimed exclusively at providing her son with food, health, clothing and education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Herinques

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que já frequentam Escola, vive na casa cedida pelo pai com sua família e sustenta sua mãe que vive com ele.
Trabalha como assistente técnico numa instituição do Estado. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade da sua criação.
No futuro deseja construir sua própria casa e iniciar uma actividade comercial para aumentar a sua receita mensal, para isso compromete-se pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir fundos para poder aplicar nos seus projectos.
texts.en:
He's married and has two children who already attend school. He lives with his family in a house provided by his father and he also supports his mother who lives with him.
He works as a technical assistant for a public institution. With the current loan he intends to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins in order to increase the quantity of the chickens he raises.
In the future he wishes to build a house of his own and to start a business so that he can increase his monthly income. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is obtaining funds in order to invest in his projects.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins for raising broiler chickens.

loans.name: Reyna Group

texts.es: Este grupo  está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Sandra inicio su negocio  hace 24 años comprando y vendiendo ropa a menor escala teniendo un tramo  de ropa en un mercado populoso de la capital, es casada, tiene 52 años de edad y 4 hijos que junto a su esposo y una de las hijas mayores le ayudan a vender la mercadería en el mercado, tiene de estar con la institución 8 años y ha demostrado ser responsable en sus obligaciones, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa variada, Patricia vende sandalias y ropa ambulante, Martha  vende ropa ambulante.
texts.en: This group is formed by three entrepreneurial members, one of whom is Sandra. She started her business 24 years ago, when she began buying and selling clothes on a small scale with a clothing business in a popular market in the capital. Sandra is married, is 52 years old, and has 4 children. Her husband and one of her oldest daughters help her sell the goods at the market. She has been with the institution for 8 years and has proven to be responsible with her obligations. The loan will be used to buy a variety of clothing items. Patricia works as a street vendor selling sandals and clothes, while Martha is a street vendor who sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing items

loans.name: Jonny Diana

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Parcona es conocido por su clima cálido, así como también por la generosidad de sus pobladores, también  se puede encontrar el bosque de piedras, el cual son formaciones rocosas en forma de animales y personas. Diana es madre de 3 pequeños a quienes  quiere muchísimo y por quienes trabaja al igual que su esposo para darle una vida digna y sobre todo con mucha humildad. Cuando Diana tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho ver televisión sobre todo sus novelas, en ocasiones le gusta preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima Carapulcra. Diana debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería.

Con mucho entusiasmo Diana trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 5 horas diarias, ella recorre las casas de sus vecinas y amigas de su barrio y también ofrece sus productos en el mercado de su barrio como recorredora, puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y le gusta su trabajo.

Diana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su confianza y apoyo y gracias a ello Diana podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como Short, blusas, faldas, entre otros, así ella podar tener más productos para ofrecer y sus clientes tendrán más variedad de productos para escoger, de esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando día a día con todo el entusiasmo que la caracteriza para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y seguir creciendo cada día”.
texts.en:
Diana’s a very hardworking, enthusiastic woman.  She lives in Parcona District in Ica, Peru.  Parcona district is known for its hot climate as well as for the generosity of its inhabitants.  The “Bosque de Piedras” (Stone Forest) is also found here which are rock formations of animals and people.

Diana is the mother of three little ones she loves very much and for whom she and her husband work very humbly to provide with a proper life.  When Diana has a little free time she likes to watch television, especially the serial dramas and sometimes she likes to prepare one of her favorite dishes, the delicious ‘Carapulcra.’  Because of her parents’ limited economic resources, Diana was only able to study up to fifth grade of secondary school but she would have liked to have studied Nursing.

With much enthusiasm, Diana works in her business selling clothes.  She works about five hours daily going from house to house visiting her neighbors and girlfriends; she also sells her products in the local market where she works and can see up to 20 customers daily.  She believes she does well in her business because she’s very kind to customers and she likes her work.

Diana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this is the second time they’ve provided their trust and support and thanks to it Diana will be able to buy more merchandise like shorts, blouses, skirts, etc. for her business and she’ll have more products to offer and her customers will have a wider variety of products to choose from.  In this way, she will improve her income and continue working day to day with her typical enthusiasm to make her greatest dream reality: to provide her children with a good education and to continue growing every day.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Eduardo Martin

texts.es: Eduardo tiene 32 años de edad vive en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, él es soltero y vive con los padres que son mayores y su hermano menor. Eduardo es una persona que comenzó a trabajar en el servicio del transporte público (Taxi) hace 5 años trabaja generalmente por la noches por que no encontraba trabajo pero así de esta manera continuo con sus estudios de Psicología (Egresado) gracias a su dedicación y trabajo, esta actividad le ayuda a generar ingresos para poder vivir actualmente pero también cuenta con una segunda actividad de COMERCIO DE POLERAS Y CAMISAS POLO  que trae del desaguadero. Desea salir adelante para poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Eduardo colabora en los gastos familiares necesita este crédito para poder comprar mercadería para su segunda actividad por fin de año ya que existe bastante venta en esta época. El sueño principal de Eduardo es poder ejercer su profesión, hacer trabajar su taxi y obtener renta, también sueña con una casa propia y una familia el señor tiene dos actividades es taxista pero tambien vende ropa.
texts.en: Eduardo is 32 years old and lives in the Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz.  He is single and lives with his younger brother and his parents who are advancing in age.  Eduardo began to work as a taxi driver five years ago and he generally works at night because it allows him to continue his advanced studies in Psychology.  Thanks to his dedication and hard work, this job has helped him generate income to be able to live, but her also counts on a second job selling sweaters, shirts, and t-shirts that he brings from the Desaguadero river region.  He wants to get ahead in order to improve his quality of life.  Eduardo helps with the household expenses and he needs this loan in order to purchase merchandise for his second job, particularly because there is great demand during the holiday season.  His main dream is to be able to work in his field, to get his taxi to work and to obtain the rent.  He also dreams of owning his own home and having a family. He has two jobs - he is a taxi driver but also sells clothes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell, such as t-shirts and dress shirts

loans.name: Nicole Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Liliam de 46 años de edad, casada con tres hijos tiene 10 años de dedicarse a vender comida a trabajadores de empresas privadas cercana a su casa, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo y compra de utensilios de cocina , Jeannette tiene una mini  pulpería en su domicilio,Flor de Liz su negocio es venta de fritanga en su domicilio, Rosa Angélica vende frijoles cocidos, gaseosas, queso en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of four entrepreneurial members. One of these is Liliam, who is 46 years old and married with three children. She has been selling food to employees of private businesses near her home for the past 10 years. This loan will be used to purchase grains such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, and chicken, as well as kitchen utensils.

Jeannette runs a small grocery store out of her home.

Flor de Liz's business is selling fried food out of her home.

Rosa Angelica sells cooked beans, sodas, and cheese out of her home.

loans.use: purchase basic items such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, and chicken, as well as kitchen utensils such as skewers, ladles, frying pans, etc.

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn is 20 years old and is a very industrious bachelorette. To gain income, she sells different food products such as snack foods, banana cues, juices and breads. She patiently offers these goods and earns an income of PHP 4,000 each month. Her income goes for the daily allowances of her siblings who go to school. 

Annelyn aims to increase her income, so she is requesting for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy juices, snack foods, candies, biscuits and banana cues to sell. In the future, with a stable income, she will give enough allowances to her siblings.

loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Las Lindas Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Gema de 25 años de edad, soltera que hace dos años se dedica al comercio de cosméticos Avon, productos de Arabela. Estos los vende por encargos en su comunidad, el crédito lo utilizara en la compra de cosméticos Avon como  perfumes, crema para la cara, cremas para el cuerpos, crema para manos etc. Jennifer vende accesorios de acero como aretes, pulseras, dijes, anillos, Vilma vende cosméticos Avon y ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is formed by three entrepreneurial women partners. One of them is Gema, who is 25 years old and single. For the last two years she has made a living by selling Avon cosmetics and Arabela products. She sells these via pre-order in her community, and will use the loan to buy Avon cosmetics like perfumes, face cream, body lotion, hand cream, etc. 

Jennyffer sells steel accessories like earrings, bracelets, pendants and rings, and Vilma sells Avon cosmetics and new clothing.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing Avon cosmetics like perfumes, face cream, body lotion and hand cream.

loans.name: Karla Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres microempresarias una de ellas es Santos Evangelina quien vende cosméticos de la Avon, productos Arabela, ropa, zapatos tiene 4 años de tener su negocio. Invertirá el crédito en cosméticos de la Avon como champo, perfume, colonias, cremas etc. Karla tiene una pulpería en su domicilio y Reyna tiene una pequeña librería, vende comida rápida y productos de la Avon.
texts.en:
The group is formed by three micro-businesswomen, one of whom is Santos who sells Avon cosmetics, Arabela products, and shoes. She has had her business for four years. She will invest the loan in Avon cosmetics such as shampoo, perfume, cologne, creams, etc. 

Karla has a grocery store in her home and Reyna has a small bookstore, and sells fast food and Avon products.

loans.use: to buy Avon cosmetics such as shampoo, perfume, colognes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Hodson Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores tal es el caso de Sobeyda es una mujer casada con 26 años de edad posee un niño menor de 3 años se dedica a elaborar y comercializar pizza la cual las hace en su domicilio y las distribuye en los colegios cercano a su casa, cuenta con otra actividad como es la venta de ropa nueva,  ropa usada, zapatos usados, carteras usadas, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 4 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de un carrito de comida chatarra  para vender pizza ambulante, Rosibel su negocio es la venta de alcancías, maceteros para plantas, comales de barros en un mercado de la capital y José Félix vende bisuterías y juguetes al por mayor y menor en los municipios cercanos a la capital.
texts.en: This group is made up of three hard-working members.  Sobeyda is a good example.  She is a married 26 year old woman who has a young three year-old child and works making and selling pizzas that she makes in her own home.  She sells them in the schools near her home.  She also has another activity which is selling new clothes, used clothes, used shoes, and used wallets.  She has been working in that field for four years.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of a cart for selling fast food in order to sell her pizzas while walking.   Rosibel is another member whose business involves selling pots for plants, corn grinding stones, and piggy banks in a market in the capital  The other group member, José Félix, sells toys and imitation jewelry in bulk and individually in the municipal markets close to the capital.

loans.use: to purchase a cart for selling fast food in order to sell her pizzas while walking.

loans.name: Armonia Ii Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras, Martha tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera con cinco  hijos de 24, 12, 5,7 y 22 años quienes le ayudan en la comercialización de la venta de leña, carbón al por mayor en los diferentes mercados de la capital, además vende tortilla en su casa, hace y vende pozol y tiene una mini pulpería, tiene 10 años de echar tortillas de esa forma ha venido diversificando sus actividades. Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de maíz, frijoles, leña, carbón, granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Débora hecha y vende tortilla y hace nacatamales los fines de semanas y Claudia vende frijoles cocidos, leñas, cuajaditas en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is composed of three hard-working members.  Martha is 48 years old and is a single mother with five children ages 24, 12, 5, 7 and 22.  They help her with the sale of wood and coal in bulk in the different markets of the capital.  She also sells tortillas from her home.  She makes and sells pozole (a type of hominy soup), and she has a small store.  She has been making tortillas for 10 years and with that have come diverse business activities.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of corn, beans, wood, coal, basics grains like rice, sugar, and oil etc.  Another group member, Débora, makes and sells tortillas and makes tamales on the weekends.  Claudia, the third member, sells cooked beans, wood, and curds.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, wood, coal, basics grains like rice, sugar, and oil etc.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el distrito de la Tinguiña,Ica,Perú. el distrito de la tinguiña se caracteriza por tener un clima  muy cálido y acogedor, Cesar vive al lado de su esposa quien lo apoya mucho en todo el hace.  Cesar aprendió a trabajar desde muy joven ya que sus padres no tenían muchos ingresos y tuvo que trabajar para poder apoyarlos, es por ello que el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, aunque le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Cesar trabaja en su pequeño negocio de librería, él le dedica a trabajar en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante.

Cesar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería como adornos navideños, papeles decorados,  papel navideño,papelería en general, entre otros, de esta manera podrá tener variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:de ser un gran empresario.
texts.en:
Cesar is 40 years old. He lives in the district of Tinguiña, Ica, Peru. The district of Tinguiña is known for its very warm and hospitable climate. Cesar lives with his wife, who helps him a lot in everything he does. Cesar learned to work when he was very young, since his parents didn't have much income, and he had to work to be able to support them. It is for this reason that he was only able to go to school up to the fifth grade of secondary school. although he would have liked to study for a university degree.

Day after day Cesar works in his little stationery business. He works in his business about 10 hours a day, and he can assist about 20 customers daily. He believes that his business is going very well for him because he is very friendly to the customers and above all because he makes a great effort to advance.

Cesar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy merchandise such as Christmas decorations, decorated paper, and Christmas paper, among other items. In this way he will be able to have a variety of products to offer his customers and continue improving his quality of life, which will allow him to continue working to be able to realize his greatest dream: to be a great businessman

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as Christmas decorations, decorated paper, and Christmas paper, among other items

loans.name: Ayda
